intro: Phyteuma betonicifolium f. vulgare, commonly known as the common phyteuma, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of blue to purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soils. Its foliage consists of basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. The species is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and ease of cultivation.
